column4: Can anyone take a look at this http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/d5593ea32 I am trying to get a custom kernel installed and it fails when I am trying to install the debian package..
i have same problem, and i use --force-all option on dpkg -i
are you installing the 2.6.29-4 kernel?
that debian systems probasbly needs something more, like nvidia driver or something
it cant be that simple lol
are you using kernelcheck to compile yours?
i tried 2.6.29, for somereason it didnt work so i still run 2.6.28.? something
make oldconfig, make-kpkg ...
but you had a problem installing 2.6.29?
i have had that problem sine 2..28.3
AWESOME, the --force-all option worked.. its going thru the config..
it fails on some post-install process
and keep old kernel there too
what "make oldconfig" is that were your problem was?
what is kernelcheck
kernelcheck is a piece of software that Master Kernel wrote to auto download and compile kernels (newbie friendly)
is it safe to get rid of everything in /usr/src even my current kernel headers?
i make my kernels that old way, and then using make-kpkg to ubuntu .deb
make mrproper is safe to do after compile in linux source dir
you should check out the forum post.. its just a scripted application.. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=311158
and probably you can remove all sources, exept those linux-headers dirs, you need headers if you need to compile more stuff that kernel
im still getting an error
